name: mpfr
description:
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point
computations with correct rounding.

dependencies.name: gmp
dependencies.description:
GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on
signed integers, rational numbers, and floating-point numbers.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: autoconf-archive
dependencies.description:
The GNU Autoconf Archive is a collection of more than 500 macros for GNU
Autoconf.

dependencies.name: texinfo
dependencies.description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.

dependent_to.name: r-rmpfr
dependent_to.description:
R MPFR - Multiple Precision Floating-Point Reliable Arithmetic (via S4
classes and methods) for arbitrary precision floating point numbers,
including transcendental ("special") functions. To this end, Rmpfr
interfaces to the LGPL'ed MPFR (Multiple Precision Floating-Point
Reliable) Library which itself is based on the GMP (GNU Multiple
Precision) Library.

dependent_to.name: texlive
dependent_to.description:
TeX Live is an easy (we hope) way to get up and running with the TeX
document production system. It provides a comprehensive TeX system with
binaries for most flavors of Unix, including GNU/Linux, macOS, and also
Windows. It includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages,
and fonts that are free software, including support for many languages
around the world.

dependent_to.name: libbytesize
dependent_to.description:
The goal of this project is to provide a tiny library that would
facilitate the common operations with sizes in bytes.

dependent_to.name: polymake
dependent_to.description: polymake is open source software for research in polyhedral geometry

dependent_to.name: symengine
dependent_to.description: SymEngine is a fast symbolic manipulation library, written in C++.

dependent_to.name: petsc
dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependent_to.name: mfem
dependent_to.description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.

dependent_to.name: mpfi
dependent_to.description: Library for arbitrary precision interval arithmetic based on MPFR

dependent_to.name: fasttransforms
dependent_to.description:
FastTransforms provides computational kernels and driver routines for
orthogonal polynomial transforms. The univariate algorithms have a
runtime complexity of O(n log n), while the multivariate algorithms are
2-normwise backward stable with a runtime complexity of O(nd+1), where n
is the polynomial degree and d is the spatial dimension of the problem.

dependent_to.name: gawk
dependent_to.description:
If you are like many computer users, you would frequently like to make
changes in various text files wherever certain patterns appear, or
extract data from parts of certain lines while discarding the rest. To
write a program to do this in a language such as C or Pascal is a time-
consuming inconvenience that may take many lines of code. The job is
easy with awk, especially the GNU implementation: gawk. The awk utility
interprets a special-purpose programming language that makes it possible
to handle simple data-reformatting jobs with just a few lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-bigfloat
dependent_to.description:
Arbitrary-precision correctly-rounded floating-point arithmetic, via
MPFR.

dependent_to.name: hydrogen
dependent_to.description:
Hydrogen: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library. Based on the Elemental library.

dependent_to.name: piranha
dependent_to.description:
Piranha is a computer-algebra library for the symbolic manipulation of
sparse multivariate polynomials and other closely-related symbolic
objects (such as Poisson series).

dependent_to.name: sollya
dependent_to.description:
Sollya is both a tool environment and a library for safe floating-point
code development. It is particularily targeted to the automatized
implementation of mathematical floating-point libraries (libm). Amongst
other features, it offers a certified infinity (supremum) norm and a
fast Remez algorithm.

dependent_to.name: cgal
dependent_to.description:
The Computational Geometry Algorithms Library (CGAL) is a C++ library
that aims to provide easy access to efficient and reliable algorithms in
computational geometry. CGAL is used in various areas needing geometric
computation, such as geographic information systems, computer aided
design, molecular biology, medical imaging, computer graphics, and
robotics.

dependent_to.name: flint
dependent_to.description: FLINT (Fast Library for Number Theory).

dependent_to.name: bertini
dependent_to.description:
Bertini is a general-purpose solver, written in C, that was created for
research about polynomial continuation. It solves for the numerical
solution of systems of polynomial equations using homotopy continuation.

dependent_to.name: sfcgal
dependent_to.description:
SFCGAL is a C++ wrapper library around CGAL with the aim of supporting
ISO 19107:2013 and OGC Simple Features Access 1.2 for 3D operations.
SFCGAL provides standard compliant geometry types and operations, that
can be accessed from its C or C++ APIs.

dependent_to.name: amdlibm
dependent_to.description:
AMD LibM is a software library containing a collection of basic math
functions optimized for x86-64 processor-based machines. It provides
many routines from the list of standard C99 math functions. Applications
can link into AMD LibM library and invoke math functions instead of
compiler's math functions for better accuracy and performance.

dependent_to.name: mpc
dependent_to.description:
Gnu Mpc is a C library for the arithmetic of complex numbers with
arbitrarily high precision and correct rounding of the result.

dependent_to.name: suite-sparse
dependent_to.description: SuiteSparse is a suite of sparse matrix algorithms

dependent_to.name: gcc
dependent_to.description:
The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C,
Fortran, Ada, and Go, as well as libraries for these languages.

dependent_to.name: fplll
dependent_to.description:
fplll contains implementations of several lattice algorithms. The
implementation relies on floating-point orthogonalization, and LLL is
central to the code, hence the name.

dependent_to.name: elemental
dependent_to.description:
Elemental: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library.
